description: Defines a hyperlink, which is used to link from one page to another or to an element within the current page.
Defines an abbreviation or acronym, which browsers usually render with a dotted underline or a dotted border.
Defines contact information for the author or owner of a document or an article.
example:
Written by John Doe.
Visit us at:
Example.com
Box 564, Disneyland
USA

description: Defines an area inside an image map that has clickable areas.
Defines an article in a document, such as a blog post or news story.
Defines content aside from the content (like a sidebar) and should be related to the surrounding content.
example:
Some text.

Related information

Some related information here.

Some more text.

description: Defines sound or audio content in an HTML document.
example: <audio controls><source src="horse.ogg" type="audio/ogg"><source src="horse.mp3" type="audio/mpeg">Your browser does not support the audio element.</audio>

description: Defines bold text.
Specifies the base URL/target for all relative URLs in a document.
Isolates a part of text that might be formatted in a different direction from other text outside it.
Overrides the current text direction.
example: This is a test for rtl and is the opposite of bdo.

description: Defines a section that is quoted from another source.
Defines the document's body, which contains the content that is directly viewable in the browser window.
Defines a single line break.
Defines a clickable button.
Defines a region in HTML for graphics.
Defines a table caption.
Defines the title of a work, such as a book or movie.
example: According to The New York Times, the study is flawed.

description: Defines a piece of computer code.
Defines column properties for each column within a <colgroup> element.
Specifies a group of one or more columns in a table for formatting.
Links a piece of content with a machine-readable translation.
Specifies a list of pre-defined options for input controls.
example: <input list="browsers"><datalist id="browsers"><option value="Chrome"><option value="Firefox"><option value="Internet Explorer"><option value="Opera"><option value="Safari"></datalist>

description: Defines a description or value for a term (<dt>) in a description list (<dl>).
Defines text that has been deleted from a document.
Defines additional details that the user can view or hide.
Defines a definition term.
example: The HTML specification is maintained by the W3C.

description: Defines a dialog box or window.
example: <dialog open>Do you want to delete this file?</dialog>

description: Defines a division or a section in an HTML document.
Defines a description list, which groups terms (<dt>) and their descriptions (<dd>).
Defines a term (an item) in a description list (<dl>).
Defines emphasized text.
Defines a container for an external application or interactive content (e.g., a plugin).
Groups related elements in a form.
Defines a caption for a <figure> element.
Specifies self-contained content, like illustrations, diagrams, photos, code listings, etc.
Defines a footer for a document or section.
Defines an HTML form for user input.
example: <form action="submit-form" method="post"><label for="fname">First name:</label><input type="text" id="fname" name="fname"><input type="submit" value="Submit"></form>

description: Defines HTML heading level 1.
Defines HTML heading level 2.
Defines HTML heading level 3.
Defines HTML heading level 4.
Defines HTML heading level 5.
Defines HTML heading level 6.
Contains meta information about the HTML document, such as its title, scripts, and style sheets.
Defines a header for a document or section.
Defines a thematic break or horizontal rule.
example:
This is a paragraph.

This is another paragraph.

description: Defines the root of an HTML document.
Defines italicized text.
Defines an inline frame, which embeds another HTML page into the current page.
Defines an image.
Defines an input control, such as a text field, checkbox, radio button, or submit button.
Defines a text that has been inserted into a document.
Defines keyboard input.
Defines a label for an <input>, <select>, <textarea>, or <button> element.
Defines a caption for a <fieldset> element.
Defines a list item.
Defines the relationship between a document and an external resource (most used to link to stylesheets).
Defines the main content of a document.
Defines a client-side image map with clickable areas.
Defines marked or highlighted text.
Defines metadata about an HTML document, such as character set, page description, keywords, author, and viewport settings.
example: <head><meta charset="UTF-8"><meta name="description" content="Free Web tutorials"><meta name="keywords" content="HTML, CSS, JavaScript"><meta name="author" content="John Doe"><meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0"></head>

description: Defines a scalar measurement within a known range, or a fractional value.
example: My progress: 2 out of 10

description: Defines navigation links.
Defines alternative content to display when a script is not executed.
example: This page requires JavaScript to function properly.

description: Defines an embedded object, such as an image, audio, video, Java applet, ActiveX, PDF, or Flash.
Defines an ordered list.
Defines a group of related options in a dropdown list (<select> element).
example: <select name="cars"><optgroup label="Swedish Cars"><option value="volvo">Volvo</option><option value="saab">Saab</option></optgroup><optgroup label="German Cars"><option value="mercedes">Mercedes</option><option value="audi">Audi</option></optgroup></select>

description: Defines an option in a dropdown list (<select> element).
Defines the result of a calculation or user action.
example: <form oninput="result.value=parseInt(a.value)+parseInt(b.value)"><input type="range" id="a" value="50"> + <input type="number" id="b" value="50"> = <output name="result" for="a b">100</output></form>

description: Defines a paragraph.
Defines parameters for an <object> element.
Defines a container for multiple image resources.
Defines preformatted text, which preserves both spaces and line breaks.
example:
Text in a pre element    is displayed in a fixed-width font,    and it preserves both      spaces and
      line breaks

description: Represents the progress of a task, such as a download or file transfer.
Defines a short inline quotation.
example: According to The New York Times, the study is flawed.

description: Defines what to show in browsers that do not support ruby annotations.
Defines an explanation or pronunciation of characters (for East Asian typography).
Defines a ruby annotation (for East Asian typography).
Defines text that is no longer correct, accurate, or relevant.
Defines sample output from a computer program.
Defines a client-side script, such as JavaScript.
Defines a section in a document, such as chapters, headers, footers, or any other sections of the document.
Defines a dropdown list.
Defines smaller text.
Defines multiple media resources for <picture>, <audio>, and <video> elements.
example: <video controls><source src="movie.mp4" type="video/mp4"><source src="movie.ogg" type="video/ogg">Your browser does not support the video tag.</video>

description: Defines a section in a document that is used for styling purposes with CSS.
Defines important text that is typically displayed in bold.
Defines style information for an HTML document, which can include CSS or other style rules.
Defines subscripted text.
Defines a visible heading for a <details> element.
Defines superscripted text.
Defines a table.
Groups the body content in a table.
Defines a cell in a table.
Defines a container to hold HTML content hidden from the user, which can be cloned and inserted into the DOM using JavaScript.
Defines a multiline input control (textarea) within a form.
Groups the footer content in a table.
Defines a header cell in a table.
Groups the header content in a table.
Defines a date or time.
Defines the document title, which is shown in the browser's title bar or tab.
Defines a row in a table.
Defines text tracks for <audio> or <video> elements.
example: <video controls><source src="movie.mp4" type="video/mp4"><track src="subtitles_en.vtt" kind="subtitles" srclang="en" label="English"></video>

description: Defines text that should be stylistically different from normal text.
Defines an unordered list.
Defines a variable.
Defines a video.
example: <video controls><source src="movie.mp4" type="video/mp4">Your browser does not support the video tag.</video>

description: Defines a possible line break opportunity in case a word needs to be broken across lines.
example: This text is long and might break: ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ.

description: Specifies the text color for an element.
Specifies the font family for text.
Specifies the font size.
Specifies the font weight (e.g., bold or normal).
Specifies the horizontal alignment of text.
